greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to express 2n+1 as p+2a^2; p = 1 or prime, a >= 0.
comment: Goldbach conjectured this sequence is never zero.
The only zero terms appear to be for the odd numbers 5777 and 5993. - T. D. Noe, Aug 23 2008
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
L. Hodges, A lesser-known Goldbach conjecture, Math. Mag., 66 (1993), 45-47.
Index entries for sequences related to Goldbach conjecture
results.author: _David W. Wilson_
